description:
This table includes a collection of all funders available in OpenAlex. 

Docs: https://docs.openalex.org/api-entities/funders 
Snapshot date: 2023-02-13
dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: alternate_titles
schema.description: A list of alternate titles for this funder.

schema.name: cited_by_count
schema.description: The total number Works that cite a work linked to this funder.

schema.name: country_code
schema.description: The country where this funder is located, represented as an ISO two-letter country code.

schema.name: counts_by_year
schema.description: The values of works_count and cited_by_count for each of the last ten years, binned by year.

schema.name: created_date
schema.description: The date this Funder object was created in the OpenAlex dataset, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string.

schema.name: description
schema.description: A short description of this funder, taken from Wikidata.

schema.name: display_name
schema.description: The primary name of the funder.

schema.name: grants_count
schema.description: The number of grants linked to this funder.

schema.name: homepage_url
schema.description: The URL for this funder's primary homepage.

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAlex ID for this funder.

schema.name: ids
schema.description: All the external identifiers that we know about for this funder. IDs are expressed as URIs whenever possible.

fields.name: openalex
fields.description: This funder's OpenAlex ID.

fields.name: ror
fields.description: This funder's ROR ID.

fields.name: wikidata
fields.description: This funder's Wikidata ID.

schema.name: image_thumbnail_url
schema.description: Same as image_url, but it's a smaller image.

schema.name: image_url
schema.description: URL where you can get an image representing this funder. Usually this a hotlink to a Wikimedia image, and usually it's a seal or logo.

schema.name: roles
schema.description: List of role objects, which include the role (one of institution, funder, or publisher), the id (OpenAlex ID), and the works_count.

schema.name: summary_stats
schema.description: Citation metrics for this funder

fields.name: 2yr_mean_citedness
fields.description: The 2-year mean citedness for this funder. Also known as impact factor.

fields.name: h_index
fields.description: The h-index for this funder.

fields.name: i10_index
fields.description: The i-10 index for this funder.

schema.name: updated_date
schema.description: The last time anything in this funder object changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

schema.name: works_count
schema.description: The number of works linked to this funder.

description:
This table includes a collection of all institutions available in OpenAlex. 

Docs: https://docs.openalex.org/api-entities/institutions 
Snapshot date: 2026-01-31
dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: associated_institutions
schema.description: Institutions related to this one.

schema.name: cited_by_count
schema.description: The total number Works that cite a work created by an author affiliated with this institution. Or less formally: the number of citations this institution has collected.

schema.name: country_code
schema.description: The country where this institution is located, represented as an ISO two-letter country code.

schema.name: counts_by_year
schema.description: works_count and cited_by_count for each of the last ten years, binned by year.

schema.name: created_date
schema.description: The date this Institution object was created in the OpenAlex dataset, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string.

schema.name: display_name
schema.description: The primary name of the institution.

schema.name: display_name_acronyms
schema.description: Acronyms or initialisms that people sometimes use instead of the full display_name.

schema.name: display_name_alternatives
schema.description: Other names people may use for this institution.

schema.name: geo
schema.description: A bunch of stuff we know about the location of this institution.

schema.name: homepage_url
schema.description: The URL for institution's primary homepage.

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAlex ID for this institution.

schema.name: ids
schema.description: All the persistent identifiers (PIDs) that we know about for this institution, as key: value pairs, where key is the PID namespace, and value is the PID. IDs are expressed as URIs where possible. They're all strings except for mag, which is a long integer.

schema.name: image_thumbnail_url
schema.description: Same as image_url, but it's a smaller image.

schema.name: is_super_system
schema.description: True if this institution is a super system.

schema.name: image_url
schema.description: URL where you can get an image representing this institution. Usually this is hosted on Wikipedia, and usually it's a seal or logo.

schema.name: lineage
schema.description: OpenAlex IDs of institutions. The list will include this institution's ID, as well as any parent institutions. If this institution has no parent institutions, this list will only contain its own ID.

schema.name: repositories
schema.description: Repositories (Sources with type: repository) that have this institution as their host_organization.

schema.name: roles
schema.description: List of role objects, which include the role (one of institution, funder, or publisher), the id (OpenAlex ID), and the works_count.

schema.name: ror
schema.description: The ROR ID for this institution.

schema.name: summary_stats
schema.description: Citation metrics for this institution.

fields.name: 2yr_mean_citedness
fields.description: The 2-year mean citedness for this institution. Also known as impact factor.

fields.name: h_index
fields.description: The h-index for this institution.

fields.name: i10_index
fields.description: The i-10 index for this institution.

schema.name: type
schema.description: The institution's primary type, using the ROR type controlled vocabulary.

schema.name: updated_date
schema.description: The last time anything in this Institution changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

schema.name: works_api_url
schema.description: A URL that will get you a list of all the Works affiliated with this institution.

schema.name: works_count
schema.description: The number of Works created by authors affiliated with this institution. Or less formally: the number of works coming out of this institution.

description:
This table includes a collection of all publishers available in OpenAlex. 

Docs: https://docs.openalex.org/api-entities/publishers 
Snapshot date: 2024-11-25
dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: alternate_titles
schema.description: A list of alternate titles for this publisher.

schema.name: cited_by_count
schema.description: The number of citations to works that are linked to this publisher through journals or other sources.

schema.name: country_codes
schema.description: The countries where the publisher is primarily located, as an ISO two-letter country code.

schema.name: counts_by_year
schema.description: The values of works_count and cited_by_count for each of the last ten years, binned by year. To put it another way: for every listed year, you can see how many new works are linked to this publisher, and how many times any work linked to this publisher was cited.

schema.name: created_date
schema.description: The date this Publisher object was created in the OpenAlex dataset, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string.

schema.name: display_name
schema.description: The primary name of the publisher.

schema.name: hierarchy_level
schema.description: The hierarchy level for this publisher. A publisher with hierarchy level 0 has no parent publishers. A hierarchy level 1 publisher has one parent above it, and so on.

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAlex ID for this publisher.

schema.name: ids
schema.description: All the external identifiers that we know about for this publisher. IDs are expressed as URIs whenever possible.

fields.name: openalex
fields.description: This publishers's OpenAlex ID.

fields.name: ror
fields.description: This publisher's ROR ID.

fields.name: wikidata
fields.description: This publisher's Wikidata ID.

schema.name: image_thumbnail_url
schema.description: Same as image_url, but it's a smaller image.

schema.name: image_url
schema.description: URL where you can get an image representing this publisher. Usually this a hotlink to a Wikimedia image, and usually it's a seal or logo.

schema.name: lineage
schema.description: OpenAlex IDs of publishers.

schema.name: roles
schema.description: List of role objects, which include the role (one of institution, funder, or publisher), the id (OpenAlex ID), and the works_count.

schema.name: sources_api_url
schema.description: An URL that will get you a list of all the sources published by this publisher.

schema.name: summary_stats
schema.description: Citation metrics for this publisher

fields.name: 2yr_mean_citedness
fields.description: The 2-year mean citedness for this publisher. Also known as impact factor.

fields.name: h_index
fields.description: The h-index for this publisher.

fields.name: i10_index
fields.description: The i-10 index for this publisher.

schema.name: updated_date
schema.description: The last time anything in this publisher object changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

schema.name: works_count
schema.description: The number of works published by this publisher.

description:
This table includes a collection of all sources available in OpenAlex. 

Docs: https://docs.openalex.org/api-entities/sources 
Snapshot date: 2025-11-02
dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: abbreviated_title
schema.description: An abbreviated title obtained from the ISSN Centre.

schema.name: alternate_titles
schema.description: Alternate titles for this source, as obtained from the ISSN Centre and individual work records, like Crossref DOIs, that carry the source name as a string. These are commonly abbreviations or translations of the source's canonical name.

schema.name: apc_prices
schema.description: List of objects, each with price (Integer) and currency (String).

schema.name: apc_usd
schema.description: The source's article processing charge in US Dollars, if available from DOAJ.

schema.name: cited_by_count
schema.description: The total number of Works that cite a Work hosted in this source.

schema.name: country_code
schema.description: The country that this source is associated with, represented as an ISO two-letter country code.

schema.name: counts_by_year
schema.description: works_count and cited_by_count for each of the last ten years, binned by year.

schema.name: created_date
schema.description: The date this Source object was created in the OpenAlex dataset, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string.

schema.name: display_name
schema.description: The name of the source.

schema.name: homepage_url
schema.description: The starting page for navigating the contents of this source; the homepage for this source's website.

schema.name: host_organization
schema.description: The host organization for this source as an OpenAlex ID. This will be an Institution.id if the source is a repository, and a Publisher.id if the source is a journal, conference, or eBook platform (based on the type field).

schema.name: host_organization_name
schema.description: The display_name from the host_organization, shown for convenience.

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAlex ID for this source.

schema.name: ids
schema.description: All the external identifiers that we know about for this source. IDs are expressed as URIs whenever possible.

fields.name: openalex
fields.description: This source's OpenAlex ID. Same as Source.id

fields.name: issn_l
fields.description: This source's ISSN-L. Same as Source.issn_l

fields.name: mag
fields.description: This source's Microsoft Academic Graph ID

fields.name: issn
fields.description: A list of this source's ISSNs. Same as Source.issn

fields.name: fatcat
fields.description: This source's Fatcat ID

fields.name: wikidata
fields.description: This source's Wikidata ID

schema.name: is_core
schema.description: Whether this source is identified as a core source by CWTS, used in the Open Leiden Ranking of universities around the world.

schema.name: is_in_doaj
schema.description: Whether this is a journal listed in the Directory of Open Access Journals (DOAJ).

schema.name: is_oa
schema.description: Whether this is currently fully-open-access source. This could be true for a preprint repository where everything uploaded is free to read, or for a Gold or Diamond open access journal, where all newly published Works are available for free under an open license.

schema.name: issn
schema.description: The ISSNs used by this source. Many publications have multiple ISSNs (see above), so ISSN-L should be used when possible.

schema.name: issn_l
schema.description: The ISSN-L identifying this source. This is the Canonical External ID for sources.

schema.name: societies
schema.description: Societies on whose behalf the source is published and maintained, obtained from our crowdsourced list.

schema.name: summary_stats
schema.description: Citation metrics for this source.

fields.name: 2yr_mean_citedness
fields.description: The 2-year mean citedness for this source. Also known as impact factor.

fields.name: h_index
fields.description: The h-index for this source.

fields.name: i10_index
fields.description: The i-10 index for this source.

schema.name: type
schema.description: The type of source

schema.name: updated_date
schema.description: The last time anything in this Source object changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

schema.name: works_api_url
schema.description: A URL that will get you a list of all this source's Works.

schema.name: works_count
schema.description: The number of Works this this source hosts.

description:
This table includes a collection of all topics available in OpenAlex. 

Docs: https://docs.openalex.org/api-entities/topics 
Snapshot date: 2024-12-04
dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: cited_by_count
schema.description: The number of citations to works that have been tagged with this topic. Or less formally: the number of citations to this topic.

schema.name: created_date
schema.description: The date this Topic object was created in the OpenAlex dataset, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string.

schema.name: description
schema.description: A description of this topic, generated by AI.

schema.name: display_name
schema.description: The English-language label of the topic.

schema.name: domain
schema.description: The ID and the name (display_name) for the domain of this topic. The domain is the highest level in the domain, field, subfield, topic system, which means it is the least granular.

schema.name: field
schema.description: The ID and the name (display_name) for the field of this topic. The field is the second-highest level in the domain, field, subfield, topic system, which means it is the second-least granular.

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAlex ID for this topic.

schema.name: ids
schema.description: All the external identifiers that we know about for this topic. IDs are expressed as URIs whenever possible.

schema.name: keywords
schema.description: Keywords consisting of one or several words each, meant to represent the content of the papers in the topic. These keywords were generated as part of the AI model.

schema.name: subfield
schema.description: The ID and the name (display_name) for the subfield of this topic. The subfield is the third-highest level in the domain, field, subfield, topic system, which means it is the third-least granular.

schema.name: updated_date
schema.description: The last time anything in this topic object changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

schema.name: works_count
schema.description: The number of works tagged with this topic.

description:

dataset_description: This dataset contains the most recent OpenAlex-Walden Snapshot.

schema.name: awards
schema.description: List of dehydrated Award objects representing awards or grants associated with this work.

schema.name: authorships
schema.description: List of Authorship objects, each representing an author and their institution.

fields.name: affiliations
fields.description: Each institutional affiliation that this author has claimed will be listed here: the raw affiliation string that we found, along with the OpenAlex Institution ID or IDs that we matched it to.

fields.name: author
fields.description: An author of this work, as a dehydrated Author object.

fields.name: author_position
fields.description: A summarized description of this author's position in the work's author list. Possible values are first, middle, and last.

fields.description: The country or countries for this author.

fields.name: institutions
fields.description: The institutional affiliations this author claimed in the context of this work, as dehydrated Institution objects.

fields.name: is_corresponding
fields.description: If true, this is the corresponding author for this work. If false, this is not the corresponding author. If null, either this work has no corresponding author, or we are not aware of it.

fields.name: raw_affiliation_strings
fields.description: This author's affiliation as it originally came to us (on a webpage or in an API), as a list of raw unformatted strings. If there is only one affiliation, it will be a list of length one.

fields.name: raw_author_name
fields.description: This author's name as it originally came to us (on a webpage or in an API), as a raw unformatted string.

schema.name: apc_list
schema.description: Information about this work's APC (article processing charge).

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: The source of this data. Currently the only value is doaj (DOAJ)

fields.name: value_usd
fields.description: The APC converted into USD.

schema.description: Information about the paid APC (article processing charge) for this work.

fields.name: value_usd
fields.description: The APC converted into USD.

schema.description: Old-timey bibliographic info for this work. This is mostly useful only in citation/reference contexts.

schema.name: cited_by_count

schema.name: concepts

schema.description: The Field-weighted Citation Impact (FWCI), calculated for a work as the ratio of citations received / citations expected in the year of publications and three following years.

description:
This table includes a collection of publications from Unpaywall. The collection comprises publications from 2008 to 2019.

Docs: https://unpaywall.org/data-format
Snapshot file: unpaywall_snapshot_2019-02-21T031509.jsonl.gz
dataset_description: Historical Unpaywall Snapshots. Only includes records from 2008 onwards.

schema.name: year
schema.description: The year this resource was published. Just uses the year part of the `published_date`.

schema.name: genre
schema.description: The type of resource, currently identical to the Crossref-reported type of a given resource. Here, only the `journal-article` type is considered, but there are many others.

schema.name: updated
schema.description: Time when the data for this resource was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`

schema.name: published_date
schema.description: The date this resource was published, as  reported by the publishers, who unfortunately have inconsistent definitions of what counts as officially `published.` Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp, generally with only year-month-day.

schema.name: journal_is_in_doaj
schema.description: Indicates whether this resource is published in a DOAJ-indexed journal.

schema.name: journal_is_oa
schema.description: Indicates whether this resource published in a completely OA journal. Under construction. Included for future compatibility. Will eventually include any fully-OA publication venue, regardless of inclusion in DOAJ.

schema.name: journal_issns
schema.description: Any ISSNs assigned to the journal publishing this resource.Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Example: `1232-1203,1532-6203`

schema.name: oa_locations
schema.description: The OA Location object describes particular place where we found a given OA article. The same article is often available from multiple locations, and there may be differences in format, version, and license depending on the location; the OA Location object describes these key attributes. An OA Location Object is always a Child of a DOI Object.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url_for_pdf if there is one; otherwise landing page URL.

fields.name: evidence
fields.description: How Unpaywall found this OA location. Used for debugging. Do not depend on the exact contents of this for anything, because values are subject to change without warning. Example values: `oa journal (via journal title in doaj)`:  name of the journal that publishes this article found in the DOAJ database; `oa repository (via pmcid lookup)`: article found in an index of PubMed Central articles.

fields.name: pmh_id
fields.description: OAI-PMH endpoint where we found this location. This is primarily for internal debugging. It's `Null` for locations that weren't found using OAI-PMH.

fields.name: is_best
fields.description: Is this location the `best_oa_location` for its resource.

fields.name: license
fields.description: The license under which this copy is published, returns several types of licenses: Creative Commons licenses are uniformly abbreviated and lowercased (Example: `cc-by-nc`); Publisher-specific licenses are normalized using this format: `acs-specific: authorchoice/editors choice usage agreement`; When we have evidence that an OA license of some kind was used, but it is not reported directly on the webpage at this location, this field returns `implied-oa`.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Time when the data for this location was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`

fields.name: version
fields.description: The content version accessible at this location. Unpaywall uses the DRIVER Guidelines v2.0 VERSION standard to define versions of a given article; see those docs for complete definitions of terms. Here's the basic idea, though, for the three version types they support: `submittedVersion` is not yet peer-reviewed; `acceptedVersion` is peer-reviewed, but lacks publisher-specific formatting; `publishedVersion` is the version of record.

fields.name: host_type
fields.description: The type of host that serves this OA location. There are two possible values: `publisher` means the this location is served by the article's publisher (in practice, this means it is hosted on the same domain the DOI resolves to); `repository` means this location is served by an Open Access repository.

fields.name: url_for_pdf
fields.description: The URL with a PDF version of this OA copy.

fields.name: url_for_landing_page
fields.description: The URL for a landing page describing this OA copy. When the `host_type` is `publisher` the landing page usually includes HTML fulltext.

schema.name: doi
schema.description: The DOI of this resource. This is always lowercase.

schema.name: is_oa
schema.description: Indicates whether there is an OA copy of this resource.

schema.name: publisher
schema.description: The name of this resource's publisher. Keep in mind that publisher name strings change over time, particularly as publishers are acquired or split up.

schema.name: journal_name
schema.description: The name of the journal publishing this resource. The same journal may have multiple name strings (eg, `J. Foo`, "Journal of Foo", "JOURNAL OF FOO", etc). These have not been fully normalized within the database, so use with care.

schema.name: data_standard
schema.description: Indicates the data collection approaches used for this resource. Possible values are `1` for first-generation hybrid detection. Uses only data from the Crossref API to determine hybrid status. Does a good job for Elsevier articles and a few other publishers, but most publishers are not checked for hybrid; `2` for second-generation hybrid detection. Uses additional sources, checks all publishers for hybrid. Gets about 10x as much hybrid, version used in the paper about the Unpaywall dataset.

schema.name: genre
schema.description: The type of resource, currently identical to the Crossref-reported type of a given resource. Here, only the `journal-article` type is considered, but there are many others.

schema.name: is_paratext
schema.description: Is the resource an ancillary part of the journal, e.g., a table of contents? Presumably manually classified.

schema.name: is_oa
schema.description: Indicates whether there is an OA copy of this resource.

schema.name: journal_is_in_doaj
schema.description: Indicates whether this resource is published in a DOAJ-indexed journal.

schema.name: journal_is_oa
schema.description: Indicates whether this resource published in a completely OA journal. Under construction. Included for future compatibility. Will eventually include any fully-OA publication venue, regardless of inclusion in DOAJ.

schema.name: journal_issn_l
schema.description: The ISSN_L of the journal publishing this resource.

schema.name: journal_issns
schema.description: Any ISSNs assigned to the journal publishing this resource.Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Separate ISSNs are sometimes assigned to print and electronic versions of the same journal. If there are multiple ISSNs, they are separated by commas. Example: `1232-1203,1532-6203`

schema.name: journal_name
schema.description: The name of the journal publishing this resource. The same journal may have multiple name strings (eg, `J. Foo`, "Journal of Foo", "JOURNAL OF FOO", etc). These have not been fully normalized within the database, so use with care.

schema.name: oa_locations
schema.description: The OA Location object describes a particular place where we found a given OA article. The same article is often available from multiple locations, and there may be differences in format, version, and license depending on the location; the OA Location object describes these key attributes. An OA Location Object is always a Child of a DOI Object.

fields.name: evidence
fields.description: How Unpaywall found this OA location. Used for debugging. Do not depend on the exact contents of this for anything, because values are subject to change without warning. Example values: `oa journal (via journal title in doaj)`:  name of the journal that publishes this article found in the DOAJ database; `oa repository (via pmcid lookup)`: article found in an index of PubMed Central articles.

fields.name: host_type
fields.description: The type of host that serves this OA location. There are two possible values: `publisher` means the this location is served by the article's publisher (in practice, this means it is hosted on the same domain the DOI resolves to); `repository` means this location is served by an Open Access repository.

fields.name: is_best
fields.description: Is this location the `best_oa_location` for its resource?

fields.name: license
fields.description: The license under which this copy is published, returns several types of licenses: Creative Commons licenses are uniformly abbreviated and lowercased (Example: `cc-by-nc`); Publisher-specific licenses are normalized using this format: `acs-specific: authorchoice/editors choice usage agreement`; When we have evidence that an OA license of some kind was used, but it is not reported directly on the webpage at this location, this field returns `implied-oa`.

fields.name: pmh_id
fields.description: OAI-PMH endpoint where we found this location. This is primarily for internal debugging. It's `Null` for locations that weren't found using OAI-PMH.

fields.name: repository_institution
fields.description: Hosting institution of the repository, presumably derived from the (sub-)domain of the url.

fields.name: url_for_landing_page
fields.description: The URL for a landing page describing this OA copy. When the `host_type` is `publisher` the landing page usually includes HTML fulltext.

fields.name: url_for_pdf
fields.description: The URL with a PDF version of this OA copy.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The content version accessible at this location. Unpaywall uses the DRIVER Guidelines v2.0 VERSION standard to define versions of a given article; see those docs for complete definitions of terms. Here's the basic idea, though, for the three version types they support: `submittedVersion` is not yet peer-reviewed; `acceptedVersion` is peer-reviewed, but lacks publisher-specific formatting; `publishedVersion` is the version of record.

schema.name: oa_status
schema.description: Open Access type. Possible values are gold, hybrid, bronze, green and closed. Categories are exclusive and labels are assigned in this hierarchy.

schema.description: The name of this resource's publisher. Keep in mind that publisher name strings change over time, particularly as publishers are acquired or split up.

schema.name: updated
schema.description: Time when the data for this resource was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`

schema.name: year
schema.description: The year this resource was published. Just uses the year part of the `published_date`.

fields.description: When this document first became available at this location. oa_date is calculated differently for different host types and is not available for all oa_locations.

fields.name: pmh_id
fields.description: OAI-PMH endpoint where we found this location. This is primarily for internal debugging. It's `Null` for locations that weren't found using OAI-PMH.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: Time when the data for this location was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: 2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`

fields.name: repository_institution
fields.description: Hosting institution of the repository, presumably derived from the (sub-)domain of the url.

fields.name: url_for_landing_page
fields.description: The URL for a landing page describing this OA copy. When the `host_type` is `publisher` the landing page usually includes HTML fulltext.

fields.name: url_for_pdf
fields.description: The URL with a PDF version of this OA copy.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The content version accessible at this location. Unpaywall uses the DRIVER Guidelines v2.0 VERSION standard to define versions of a given article; see those docs for complete definitions of terms. Here's the basic idea, though, for the three version types they support: `submittedVersion` is not yet peer-reviewed; `acceptedVersion` is peer-reviewed, but lacks publisher-specific formatting; `publishedVersion` is the version of record.

schema.name: oa_locations_embargoed
schema.description: This list includes locations that we expect to be available in the future based on information like license metadata and journals' delayed OA policies. They do not affect the resource's oa_status and cannot be the best_oa_location or first_oa_location.

fields.name: evidence
fields.description: How Unpaywall found this OA location. Used for debugging. Do not depend on the exact contents of this for anything, because values are subject to change without warning. Example values: `oa journal (via journal title in doaj)`:  name of the journal that publishes this article found in the DOAJ database; `oa repository (via pmcid lookup)`: article found in an index of PubMed Central articles.

fields.name: host_type
fields.description: The type of host that serves this OA location. There are two possible values: `publisher` means the this location is served by the article's publisher (in practice, this means it is hosted on the same domain the DOI resolves to); `repository` means this location is served by an Open Access repository.

fields.name: is_best
fields.description: Is this location the `best_oa_location` for its resource?

fields.name: license
fields.description: The license under which this copy is published, returns several types of licenses: Creative Commons licenses are uniformly abbreviated and lowercased (Example: `cc-by-nc`); Publisher-specific licenses are normalized using this format: `acs-specific: authorchoice/editors choice usage agreement`; When we have evidence that an OA license of some kind was used, but it is not reported directly on the webpage at this location, this field returns `implied-oa`.

schema.name: oa_status
schema.description: Open Access type. Possible values are gold, hybrid, bronze, green and closed. Categories are exclusive and labels are assigned in this hierarchy.

schema.name: publisher
schema.description: The name of this resource's publisher. Keep in mind that publisher name strings change over time, particularly as publishers are acquired or split up.

schema.name: published_date
schema.description: The date this resource was published as reported by the publishers.

schema.name: doi_updated
schema.description: Time when the data for this resource was last updated. Returned as an ISO8601-formatted timestamp. Example: `2017-08-17T23:43:27.753663`

schema.name: year
schema.description: The year this resource was published. Just uses the year part of the `published_date`.

The set of authoritative pid is: doi when collected from Crossref or Datacite pmid when collected from EuroPubmed, arxiv when collected from arXiv, handle from the repositories

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: The reason why OpenAIRE holds the relation

fields.name: trust
fields.description: The trust of the relation in the range of [0,1]. Where greater the number, more the trust. Harvested relationships have typically a high trust (0.9). The trust of inferred relationship is calculated by the inference algorithm that generated them, as described in https://graph.openaire.eu/about#architecture (Enrichment --> Mining)

fields.name: pid
fields.description: The author's persistent identifiers

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: The reason why the pid was associated to the author

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The author's pid scheme.  OpenAIRE currently supports 'ORCID'

fields.name: value
fields.description: The author's pid value in that scheme (i.e. 0000-1111-2222-3333)

schema.name: bestAccessRight
schema.description: The openest of the access rights of this result.

fields.name: code
fields.description: COAR access mode code: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label for the access mode

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Scheme of reference for access right code. Always set to COAR access rights vocabulary: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

schema.name: container
schema.description: Container has information about the conference or journal where the result has been presented or published

fields.name: edition
fields.description: Edition of the journal or conference proceeding

fields.name: ep
fields.description: End page

fields.name: iss
fields.description: Journal issue number

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the journal or conference

fields.name: sp
fields.description: Start page

fields.name: vol
fields.description: Volume

schema.name: contributors
schema.description: Contributors for the result

schema.name: countries
schema.description: The list of countries associated to this result

fields.name: code
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code (i.e. IT)

fields.name: label
fields.description: The label for that code (i.e. Italy)

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: Why this result is associated to the country.

schema.name: dateOfCollection
schema.description: When OpenAIRE collected the record the last time

schema.name: embargoenddate
schema.description: Date when the embargo ends and this result turns Open Access

schema.name: id
schema.description: The OpenAIRE identifiers for this result

schema.name: indicators
schema.description: Indicators computed for this result, for example UsageCount ones

fields.name: citationImpact
fields.description: The impact measures (i.e. popularity)

fields.name: usageCounts
fields.description: The usage counts (i.e. downloads)

schema.name: instances
schema.description: Each instance is one specific materialisation or version of the result. For example, you can have one result with three instance: one is the pre-print, one is the post-print, one is te published version

fields.name: publicationDate
fields.description: Date of the research product

fields.name: refereed
fields.description: If this instance has been peer-reviewed or not. Allowed values are peerReviewed, nonPeerReviewed, UNKNOWN (as defined in https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:review_levels)

fields.name: type
fields.description: The specific sub-type of this instance (see https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:result_typologies following the links)

fields.name: urls
fields.description: URLs to the instance. They may link to the actual full-text or to the landing page at the hosting source.

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the persistent identifier for the result (i.e. doi). If the pid is here it means the information for the pid has been collected from an authority for that pid type (i.e. Crossref/Datacite for doi). The set of authoritative pid is: doi when collected from Crossref or Datacite pmid when collected from EuroPubmed, arxiv when collected from arXiv, handle from the repositories

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme (i.e. 10.1000/182)

fields.name: articleProcessingCharge
fields.description: The money spent to make this book or article available in Open Access. Source for this information is the OpenAPC initiative.

fields.name: alternateIdentifiers
fields.description: All the identifiers other than pids forged by an authorithy for the pid type (i.e. Crossref for DOIs

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the identifier. It can be a persistent identifier (i.e. doi). If it is present in the alternate identifiers it means it has not been forged by an authority for that pid. For example we collect metadata from an institutional repository that provides as identifier for the result also the doi

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme

fields.name: accessRight
fields.description: The accessRights for this materialization of the result

fields.name: code
fields.description: COAR access mode code: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label for the access mode

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: Scheme of reference for access right code. Always set to COAR access rights vocabulary: http://vocabularies.coar-repositories.org/documentation/access_rights/

fields.name: code
fields.description: alpha-3/ISO 639-2 code of the language

fields.name: label
fields.description: Language label in English

schema.name: lastUpdateTimeStamp
schema.description: Timestamp of last update of the record in OpenAIRE

schema.name: mainTitle
schema.description: A name or title by which a scientific result is known. May be the title of a publication, of a dataset or the name of a piece of software.

schema.name: originalIds
schema.description: Identifiers of the record at the original sources

schema.name: pids
schema.description: Persistent identifiers of the result

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: The scheme of the persistent identifier for the result (i.e. doi). If the pid is here it means the information for the pid has been collected from an authority for that pid type (i.e. Crossref/Datacite for doi). The set of authoritative pid is: doi when collected from Crossref or Datacite pmid when collected from EuroPubmed, arxiv when collected from arXiv, handle from the repositories

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value expressed in the scheme (i.e. 10.1000/182)

schema.name: publicationDate
schema.description: Main date of the research product: typically the publication or issued date.

schema.name: publisher
schema.description: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the resource.

schema.name: sources
schema.description: See definition of Dublin Core field dc:source

schema.name: subjects
schema.description: Keywords associated to the result

fields.name: scheme
fields.description: OpenAIRE subject classification scheme (https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:subject_classification_typologies).

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value for the subject in the selected scheme.  When the scheme is 'keyword', it means that the subject is free-text (i.e. not a term from a controlled vocabulary).

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: Why this subject is associated to the result

schema.name: subTitle
schema.description: Explanatory or alternative name by which a scientific result is known.

schema.name: type
schema.description: Type of the result: one of 'publication', 'dataset', 'software', 'other' (see also https://api.openaire.eu/vocabularies/dnet:result_typologies)

schema.name: size
schema.description: Only for results with type 'dataset': the declared size of the dataset

schema.name: documentationUrls
schema.description: Only for results with type 'software': URL to the software documentation

schema.name: programmingLanguage
schema.description: Only for results with type 'software': the programming language

schema.name: codeRepositoryUrl
schema.description: Only for results with type 'software': the URL to the repository with the source code

schema.name: contactPeople
schema.description: Only for results with type 'software': Information on the person responsible for providing further information regarding the resource

schema.name: contactGroups
schema.description: Only for results with type 'software': Information on the group responsible for providing further information regarding the resource

schema.name: tools
schema.description: Only for results with type 'other': tool useful for the interpretation and/or re-used of the research product

schema.name: geoLocations
schema.description: Geolocation information

dataset_description: Data from the OpenAPC initiative
OpenCitations Meta -  bibliographic metadata for all publications included in the OpenCitations Index
PKP Beacon dataset - details of publications using software by the Public Knowledge Project
PKP Beacon dataset - details of publications using software by the Public Knowledge Project
